Posts.Content: Jun 28, 2010 03:56PM lucylou wrote: Hi just wanted to say I wish all you ladies the best of luck and (((((HUGS))))) all around. I'm sure you will do great. Before surgery is hard with all the waiting. Much better on the other side. I just wanted you all to know that i will be thinking of each and everyone of you. Lucy
Posts.Title: June 2010 Mastectomy jsmiley60 reneemac

Posts.Content: May 31, 2010 08:29PM lucylou wrote: MistyJ, I also have LCIS and I know what you mean by never wanting to face invasive BC. I say take them off and lower the risk. I'm not one of those people that can go through all of the testing every 6 months. I would die from the stress of all of that. Not that facing BMX is not stressful. In 2 days from now my breast will be gone. It at times is so hard to think of my breasts not be there. And then at other times i think of all of the fear and stress i have gone through over the years and think it will be a relief to know that i have done all i can do. This website has meant so much to me and helped me through some really dark hours. Love and strength to all of my gals in there fight. Lets kick it.
Posts.Title: June 2010 Mastectomy jsmiley60 reneemac

Posts.Content: Jul 11, 2010 11:56AM lucylou wrote: Hi Everyone, Hope all is going well for all of you. I'm going to th BS on Tuesday for my 6 week check up. I cannot believe how fast it has gone by. I'm looking forward to getting my RX for my mastectomy bra's and foobs. I have not liked wearing  the starter cami. I'm to hot blooded for that thing. I told my DH the other day. I cannot believe I don't miss my boobs. I would never have thought I would have said that. But it's true. I have alot more piece of mind now. I hope all of us have alot more piece of mind. For those of you that did recon. I hope you are all healing nicely. I just want to say that you all have meant alot to me. I don't post much but know that you are all in my thoughts and prayers. Take Care Lucy
Posts.Title: June 2010 Mastectomy jsmiley60 reneemac

Posts.Content: May 30, 2010 06:35PM lucylou wrote: I'm having a BMX June 2. Starting to feel really uptight about it. I'm not doing any recon for now. I just need to get past this part for now. My surgery time is 1:00 PM I hope they call and move it up. I hate the thought of waiting all morning. I think I might jump out of my skin. One minute i'm fine, the next i'm just about to lose it. Hope all goes well for all of you.
Posts.Title: June 2010 Mastectomy jsmiley60 reneemac

Posts.Content: Jun 10, 2010 07:39PM lucylou wrote: JSMILEY Just wanted to say I will thinking of you and praying for you. Know that you are doing the right thing, the surgery is not bad at all. Lets us know when you can how you are doing. BIGS HUGS COMING YOUR WAY Lucy

Posts.Content: Jun 1, 2010 10:29PM lucylou wrote: Well it's the day before surgery and what a day it has been. I work part time for walmart and they fired me today. I have worked there for over 3 yrs. They said I didnot have enough hrs for a leave of absence. All I wanted was a few weeks off no pay. Well I guess I will get that and alot more. I should be getting pack to go to the hospital but I can't seem to get it together today. Really feeling very scared right now.

Posts.Content: Dec 11, 2011 11:23PM lucylou wrote: It has been a very long time since i was last here. But hope that all of you June 2010 gals are doing well. And I just wanted to wish you all a Merry Christmas and a Happy New Year!!!!!
Posts.Title: June 2010 Mastectomy jsmiley60 reneemac

Posts.Content: Jun 21, 2010 03:19AM lucylou wrote: Hi sounds like everyone is coming along pretty well, I think of all of you often. For those ofyou that have your drains out. Do you get fulid build up? And does anyone know how long this goes on. I have been trying to wear my after surgery cami, but sometimes it seems to be uncomfortable. Just wondering how long until this fluid keeps coming. Take Care Lucy
Posts.Title: June 2010 Mastectomy jsmiley60 reneemac

Posts.Content: Jun 9, 2010 08:04AM lucylou wrote: Hi everyone, Recovery is going pretty good. Have not had any pain meds since last friday night. I went to my BS on 'Tuesday. My path. came back with no new surprizes so I was so happy about that. He said I should be able to get my drains out on Thursday. I will be glaf to get rid of those. JSMILEY I hope your surgery goes well. And I will be thinking of you. Cry if you need to cry or freak out or whatever you need to do to get through this we all get through things differently. Just know on the other side will be much better than the waiting side. I will keep you in my thoughts and prayer.  About the sex thing I wanted to before surgery, it was bitter sweet. But I wanted to try and remember what normal felt like, before i find my new normal. And i will find it. Thinking and prayer for all of you. Lucy
Posts.Title: June 2010 Mastectomy jsmiley60 reneemac

Posts.Content: Jun 29, 2010 04:46PM lucylou wrote: Dear Jeanne, Sorry you are feeling down. It does sound like you have had a very hard year. It took about 3 weeks after my surgery until I felt more like myself. Don't be to hard on yourself. Sounds like you have some good family and friends. I'm sure they don't mind helping you out. I know its hard to keep asking for help. But just remember that if they ever need help you will be there to help them. I hope your doctors appt. go well. I can't remember if you had reconstruction or not, if you did it just may take alittle longer to get back into the swing of things. Don't give up just keep moving forward, even If its little steps at a time. I live in Van Wert Ohio, so thats only 1 1/2 hrs from you. Maybe someday we could meet halfway and have lunch or something? Take Care Lucy

Posts.Title: What made you decide not to recon lucylou 3jaysmom

Posts.Content: May 7, 2010 08:28AM lucylou wrote: Thank you to all of you gals that gave me your thought and opinions. The reason I say i need to decide is that i hope to be getting a job as a bus driver this next school year. And I would like to have this surgery before then and hopefully healed by the time the next school year starts. I just really want to move on with my life. I have been thinking of all most nothing else. I seem to be stuck. I no what i need to do, but am having a hard time making the final decision. Thank you all so much again. I have gained so much hope from this website.

Posts.Content: Sep 9, 2010 10:51AM lucylou wrote: Well i finially got ahold of the Drs office. I told them what i was feeling and they went and spoke with the dr. and he said it was normal for that to happen. I said what does he think it could be and they said he just said it was normal but if it got any bigger to contact them right away. I'm not sure how comfortable i'm with that. Just leaves me wondering hummmm!!!! Thanks again for getting with me it helped me not to worry so much. Lucy

Posts.Content: lucylou wrote: Hi just wanted to drop in and say i got my new "GIRLS". And I really like them. Very happy that I didnot reconstruct. My surgeon left me extra skin in case i wanted to do recon. But I think next summer i will have the extra skin removed. I don't ever see myself doing recon.  I have found not have breasst to being a freeing experience. Some of my friends don't get it. But I don't care. I ordered some of those micro bead ones and they came I thought they were to flat. I ordered the same size i have in silicone but they seemed way to small. So i think i shall try and my some myself. I want to thank all of you that helped me early on in my journey. I meant alot to me.  Lucy. Dx 2/25/2010, LCIS, <1cm, Stage 0 Log in to post a reply
